answers.answer: Ooops, I was on metformin until the end of my 1st trimester...not even near my third yet! :-)

Wow, they are testing you early for this.  I didn't take mine till 28 weeks.  I failed the first test, but I guess it was just barely.  I took it in the late afternoon and had a salad late morning (which I was told would be fine).  It wasn't, it was just enough to fail the test.  I took the 3 hour test and passed just fine, took it starting at 7 am just to be sure.  It was not fun, but a big relief to be over with and I passed that one with flying colors.  The only thing they could think of was the salad was just enough to throw me off, but even that wasn't much.  You might be just fine, don't stress about it and good luck.

I'm sorry I don't have any advice for you, but I am just wondering why you did the 1 hr test so early? I also have PCOS, was on Met for the 1st trimester and am a little chubby. I am going to the dr today (18 weeks). Don't know if I should ask her about it? Thanks.

I am also overweight and I actually lost weight.  I am now almost 30w and about 2 pounds over my pre-pregnancy weight.  Anyway I did not pass my one hour test but I passed my three hour test.  I have heard of this happening alot. Why did they test you so early?  Most of the time you don't get tested unter between 26-30 weeks depending on the doctor.  I was tested at 26 weeks.
They tested me this early precisely because I have PCOS and was on the metformin.  I would ask if I were you...just to be safe.
I will thanks! GD is something I always thought I would get for some reason. Don't know why. Good Luck with the 3hr test, hopefully you pass!
I also wanted to add that I have not gained any weight yet. I think it's probably a good thing. I was always worried because my mom gained a TON of weight with my brother and I.

They tested me early as well and I failed the 1 hr with 148.  I passed the 3 hours with ease.  Fasting came in @ 84, 1 hr @ 121 and beyond that even better results.  Watch the carbs, no soda etc and you will be fine.  You barely failed the 1 hr so don't worry.  They tested me as my blood pressure was creeping up.  Good luck, bring lots to read!

Good luck Luv-Babies.  If your doctor hasn't suggested testing you yet, maybe it's because (s)he is not concerned about it...ask anyway though! :-)sam2..thanks so much for your post.  It did make me feel a bit better.  Also, you mentioned staying away from soda...I did have a can of orange soda a couple of hours prior to drinking the glucose drink....do you think this may have affected my results?

Hi, i've noticed that every1 here passed their 3 hr. Well i didn't! I did exactly what my dr told me to do over the wkend and i was to take it that monday. He told me to eat like i normally do. So i did, b/c i want my test results to be precise, so i won't hurt my baby.I've noticed others that had to take the 3-hour tried eating less sugar, etc. and passed it, but what if you go back to eating normal and u really do have gd and that can hurt the baby, make it serverly overweight, etc.So i was dianosed with g/d, and am on a strict diet, plus take insulin, which they will start you off on the diet, and see if the diet will control your g/d, and if it will you won't have to take the insulin. But my sugar was still high and i was staying on my diet very strictly. So i take the insulin.So i hope u don't have it! Good luck!

Hi, again.It's nice to talk to someone else who has g/d. :)I'm sorry about the bubbles. At first i was sooooo scared to give myself the shot(the 1st time) i was scared the way i was going to feel afterwards. But i felt fine. And dr told me to aslways keep candy with me incase my sugar drops to far down, and i start feeling weird. So try that incase it ever happens.yes i do sit to give myself the shot, i was told that i could give it to myself in my arm, leg, stomach. But i was scared to do it in my stomach since i'm prego, but i would only hit fat right now if i pinched it up. My leg is also really sore afterwards, gosh!And at first i didn't watch to see if i was aiming for a vein, and hit one, but now i make sure i am not aiming for a vein.I'm trying to remember everything u talked about but i know i'll leave something out. lolWell i'll give u my email addresss incase u want to talk anymore about this! I really appreciate talking to u, it does help!yes i do get depressed about the high levels b/c i do not cheat in the mornings, sometimes i will at lunch. But it's not bad, and the frigin sugar isn't high after lunch!Well here is my emaili won't answer that until monday though, as to it being my work email.***@****

I wasn't pointing fingers at you or anything. :)I just meant, that any1 i've talked to that took their 3 hour test tried only eating the 'good' foods before and passed.I did exactly what my dr told me to do. Sorry if it offended u, i didn't mean it like that. Well, thanks for the wishes!I hope yours goes well too! :))))

No, you didn't offend me at all, so sorry if I came off that way.  I have a 3 year old running around me and a new puppy so I'm a little distracted.  I totally get what you are saying though.  It's better to be honest with the Dr. and yourself than to skew the test and potentially harm yourself and baby.  I am so not looking forward to taking that test again, but I have a little while still.  I am having such a hard time still eating.  I can't stand anything sugary and most meat.  Been eating lots of veggies though, keep my fingers crossed, it's still early for me.

Yes the soda probably did it for you as you are supposed to fast for 12 hours before your test (water is ok).  Fast for 12 hrs, limit soda (super high in sugar carbs) in pregnancy.  As I said you and I were boderline, so your 3 hr will be probably fine. Have a great weekend.
Both of my good friends passed the 3hr!!! Good Luck!!!

I've been diagnosed with GD and now have to insulin at night.  Which, if you want can you help me?  I can't get the stupid air bubbles out and didn't take it last night because after twenty frustrating minutes of trying with two different syringes to get the air bubbles out I just gave up and went to bed bawling my eyes out.  Do you have any suggestions?  Hitting the syringe doesn't work for me.  The air bubbles don't go anywhere.Now, onto my real comment.  GD is one of those things that not all doctors agree on.  There is an argument that GD isn't a real condition.  There is also real evidence that insulin doesn't change the outcome at all for the baby.  Now, I'm on the lousy diet and on insulin but the only reason I'm doing so is because my numbers aren't where they should be.  Although, my daily numbers are usually too low and I've been told I need to eat A LOT more than I am.  But my rotten fasting numbers are horrible and the insulin is not even helping when I can take it.Really, if anyone can help with the air bubbles I would appreciate it.  I read in the insulin pamphlet that the issue with the air bubbles is it causes your dosage to be a little less.  So does this mean I can still take it with air bubbles?  I don't want to inject myself with air and cause a problem.Another thing with GD is that every doctor has his or her own cutoff.  Some cutoffs go as high as 160 for the one hour test.Most of the time big babies aren't from GD.

Good to know usually big babies aren't from g/d.With the air bubbles, I have a few in my surenge when i mix the does together, and afterwards i just flick the surenge and all come out except i think the one at the top. but oh well. I give myself the shot anyways.And the reason they don't want the air bubbles in it, is b/c no air is supposed to go into your vein, incase you hit one accidently. I have hit my vein twice now, and oh man it hurts afterwards! wheeeeeeeeewwww. So now i am watching where i stick myself and make sure there are no veins in the way. Sometimes when i don't hit a vein and hit the right spot some of my insulin actually comes back out. weird huh!But just get the air bubbles out the best you can, and watch it and make sure u don't hit a vein.Where do you give yourself the shot at?? I have only did it in my leg. And i do it in the mornings. My levels are pretty good except in the mornings after breakfast! Other times they are fine. And my dr wants my levels at 120 or lower 1 hr after meals. and 95 or lower before breakfast in the morning.When are yours higher?

My doctor wants my fasting levels to be 70-90 but really as close to 70 as possible.  My 1 hour after meals numbers to be between 100-135.My highest levels are my fasting levels and I can't get them to come down at this point which is why I'm on the insulin, but it isn't helping.  I have to raise the dose.It's funny how different our numbers are supposed to be.  It just goes to show it really is dependent on your doctor's way of doing things.Thanks for the help with the air bubbles.  I knew that air bubbles were a bad thing in injections, but as I said I can't seem to get all of the stinking air bubbles out no matter what I do or how hard I try!  I'm on the "cloudy" insulin.  What are you on?  I was told that the kind of insulin I'm on is only good for nighttime use and if I have to start taking insulin at meal times they will put me on the insulin pen.I usually inject the insulin on my side or my hip.  I have ample fat to choose from.  LOL.  I haven't tried my leg.  Do you do it sitting down or standing up?  I stand up as that is how I was taught to do it, but wouldn't mind actually sitting down. I'm afraid of hitting a vein too, but haven't done it yet.  Thankfully!They told me that the insulin hurts less (the actual shot) than the finger testing and I agree, but they didn't tell me how much it hurts afterwards.  After I give myself the shot of insulin I'm very sore and can't sleep on the side I gave it in.Do you keep your insulin in the refridgerator? I was told I didn't have to, but then I read the pamphlet and it says to keep in the the fridge.  So I moved it there today.  But I've also read that cold insulin hurts a lot more.Thanks for the help with the air bubbles.  I was so tired and frustrated last night that I had to give up and not give myself the shot. I just couldn't take it any longer.  I was crying and it just sucked.Oh, both my sister and sister-in-law had GD with their previous pregnancies (my sister didn't have test or take medication, don't know how that happened) and both had babies that weighed 6 pounds and some change.  In case hearing individual cases helps you feel better.Also, (sorry this is so long!) have you suffered any depression because of the GD? I find myself get a little sad about my numbers when they are higher (like my fasting numbers and how no matter what I do -- I have not "cheated" -- I can't get them down) I get sad about it.

Sherry, I didn't avoid sugar on purpose for the test, but you are supposed to avoid any food or liquids so far in advance.  In fact I couldn't eat much sugar with my first pregnancy.  I craved veggies.  I just didn't fast long enough before the 1 hour test so I was sure to take my 3 hour test asap in the morning so I had no choice.  I ate the diet my Dr. laid out for me also the night before.  I'm sorry you didn't pass, hope all goes well with your pregnancy.

I didnt know to ***** the side of your fingers I have been picking right on the fingertips and it hurts a little thanks for that info im on my 2nd preg with gd didnt show up for me until 28 weeks got tested at 20 weeks and all was good then I was hoping it wouldnt show up but know I had a good chance with having it with my first preg. Good luck with you fingers crossed you dont get it again.

question: Hi Everyone,I just had my 1 hour glucose tolerance test two days ago and my results came back high.  The cut off is 135 and my results were 145.  Now I am going for the three hour test tomorrow.  Has anyone experienced this, any advice out there?  I really hope I pass the three hour.  Has anyone failed the one hour but passed the three hour?  I am overweight to begin with but have only gained a total of four lbs. in 4 months but I do have PCOS.  I was on metformin until my thrid trimester.  Any advice or experiences anyone is willing to share would be much appreciated.  Good luck to you all!
title: 16-week Gestational Diabetes
